info.title: OPCON REST API
info.description:
Welcome to the SMA OpCon REST API reference. Use this REST API to interact with the OpCon database.

# Authentication

<!-- ReDoc-Inject: <security-definitions> -->

get.summary: Get a list of access codes based on optional criteria specified
get.description:
Sample request (this returns a list of **access codes** by **name** in **descending** order):  
        GET /api/accesscodes?sortby=name:desc

parameters.name: IncludeSecuredDailyJobs
parameters.description: Flag to show/hide list of daily jobs secured by the access code

schema.description: Flag to show/hide list of daily jobs secured by the access code

parameters.name: IncludeSecuredMasterJobs
parameters.description: Flag to show/hide ist of master jobs secured by the access code

schema.description: Flag to show/hide ist of master jobs secured by the access code

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description: Name of the calendar to fetch (Can accept ? and * wildcards)

schema.description: Name of the calendar to fetch (Can accept ? and * wildcards)

parameters.name: Ids
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of calendar unique identifier values

schema.description: Comma-separated list of calendar unique identifier values

parameters.name: Limit
parameters.description: Limits the results being fetched. 0 retrieves just a count

schema.description: Limits the results being fetched. 0 retrieves just a count

parameters.name: Offset
parameters.description: Retrieves records beginning at this record number

schema.description: Retrieves records beginning at this record number

parameters.name: SortOrders
parameters.description: Access code sort order

schema.description: Access code sort order

parameters.name: AccessibleCodes
parameters.description: List of accessible codes

schema.description: List of accessible codes

parameters.name: HasAdminAccess
parameters.description: Flag to determine admin access

schema.description: Flag to determine admin access

parameters.name: SortBy
parameters.description: Options to sort access code by

schema.description: Options to sort access code by

200.description: Returns a list of access codes

post.summary: Create a new access code and return it with its id, if successful

requestBody.description: The access code object to create

get.summary: Get an access code for the id specified
get.description:
Sample request (this returns the **access code** with **id = 1**):  
        GET /api/accesscodes/1

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the access code to fetch

schema.description: The unique identifier of the access code to fetch

put.summary: Update all properties of the access code specified by the id

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the access code

schema.description: The unique identifier of the access code

requestBody.description: The access code object to update

delete.summary: Delete the access code specified by the id
delete.description:
Sample request (this updates the **access code**):  
    DELETE /api/accesscodes/1

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the access code

schema.description: The unique identifier of the access code

get.summary: Get a list of batch users based on optional criteria specified
get.description:
Sample request (this returns a list of **batch users** by **name** in **descending** order):

parameters.description: The batch user id

get.summary: Get a calendar for the id specified
get.description:
Sample request (this returns the calendar with id=1 ):
    GET /api/calendars/1

parameters.description: Unique identifer of the calendar to fetch.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The calendar id

delete.summary: Delete the calendar having the specified id
delete.description:
Sample request (This deletes a calendar with id = 11):
    DELETE /api/calendars/11

parameters.description: The id of the calendar whose old dates to delete

schema.description: The id of the calendar whose old dates to delete

post.summary: Delete calendar dates older than 30 days from all calendars
post.description:
Sample request (this deletes dates older than 30 days from all calendars):
    POST /api/calendars/deleteOldDates

get.summary: Get a list of daily job events
get.description:
Sample request (this returns a list of **daily job events** in **descending** order):  
        GET /api/dailyJobs/{jobId}/events

200.description: Returns a list of event triggers

post.summary: Post a new daily job event

delete.description:
Sample request (this deletes a single **daily job event**):  
        DELETE /api/dailyJobs/{jobId}/events/{eventId}

get.summary: Get a list of daily job expression dependencies
get.description:
Sample request (this returns a list of **expression dependencies** in **ascending** order):  
        GET /api/dailyJobs/{dailyJobId}/expressionDependencies

parameters.name: rawId
parameters.description: The daily job unique identifier

schema.description: The daily job unique identifier

parameters.name: rawId
parameters.description: The daily job indentifier

schema.description: The daily job indentifier

requestBody.description: The expression dependency object with new values

get.summary: Get a daily job expression dependency for the id specified
get.description:
Sample request (this returns a **expression dependency** in **ascending** order):  
        GET /api/dailyJobs/{dailyJobId}/expressionDependencies/{expressionId}

parameters.name: rawId
parameters.description: The daily job identifier

schema.description: The daily job identifier

parameters.name: expressionId
parameters.description: The expression dependency identifier

schema.description: The expression dependency identifier

parameters.name: rawId

schema.description: The daily job indentifier

parameters.name: expressionId
parameters.description: The expression dependency identifier

schema.description: The expression dependency identifier

requestBody.description: The expression dependency object with update values

delete.description:
Sample request (this deletes a single **expression dependency**):  
        DELETE /api/dailyJobs/{dailyJobId}/expressionDependencies/{expressionId}

parameters.name: rawId
parameters.description: The daily job indentifier

schema.description: The daily job indentifier

parameters.name: expressionId
parameters.description: The expression dependency identifier

schema.description: The expression dependency identifier

requestBody.description: The expression dependency object with values to delete

get.summary: Get a list of job dependencies for the daily job specified
get.description:
Sample request (this returns a list of **job dependencies** for a daily job with id '20210101|15|1|Job1'):  
    GET /api/dailyjobs/20210101|15|1|Job1/dependencies

200.description: Returns a list of job dependencies

put.summary: Update the job dependencies for the daily job specified

post.summary: Add a job dependency for the daily job specified

get.summary: Get a job dependency for the daily job and job dependency id specified
get.description:
Sample request (this returns a **job dependency** with id '2' for a daily job with id '20210101|15|1|Job1'):  
    GET /api/dailyjobs/20210101|15|1|Job1/dependencies/2

put.summary: Update a job dependency for the daily job and job dependency id specified

delete.summary: Delete a job dependency with the daily job and job dependency id specified
delete.description:
Sample request (this deletes a **job dependency** with id '2' for a daily job with id '20210101|15|1|Job1'):  
    DELETE /api/dailyjobs/20210101|15|1|Job1/dependencies/2

post.summary: Deletes a collection of jobs based on a given jobId, scheduleId, or date range.

requestBody.description: The OpCon.Api.Data.Services.QueuedDelete.QueuedDeleteRequest request containing one or more request items.

get.summary: Get a department for the id specified
get.description:
Sample request (this returns the **department** with **id = 1**):  
        GET /api/departments/1

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the department you want to get

schema.description: The id of the department you want to get

get.summary: Get a list of departments based on optional criteria specified
get.description:
Sample request (this returns a list of **departments** by **name** in **descending** order):  
        GET /api/departments?sortby=name:desc

get.summary: Get a list of escalations tied to a user.
get.description:
Sample request (this returns a list of **escalations** tied to a **user** in **descending** order):

        GET /api/users/0/escalation/1

parameters.name: escalationId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of escalation to retrieve

schema.description: The unique identifier of escalation to retrieve

post.summary: Create a token for use by the user submitting the request.
post.description:
The token is stored encrypted in the database and must be copied for use by the user.
When length is provided, the generated token can only be used for external events. 
When length is not provided, the generated token can be used to interact with the API and for external events. 
To receive the token in the response, the user's isExternalTokenDisabled property must be False.

Sample request (this creates a new **external token** having 20 characters):  
    POST /api/externaltoken  
    {  
        "length": 20  
    }

get.summary: Get a list of feeback values based on optional criteria specified
get.description:
Sample request (this returns a list of **feedback values** by jobType):  
        GET /api/feedback?jobType=6

200.description: Returns a list of feedback values

get.description:
Sample request (this returns a list of frequencies by name in descending order):
    GET /api/frequencies?sortby=name:desc

get.summary: Get a list of global properties based on optional criteria specified
get.description:
Sample request (this returns a list of **global properties** by **name** in **descending** order):
        GET /api/globalproperties?sortby=name:desc

200.description: Returns a list of global properties

post.summary: Create a new global property and return it with its id, if successful

get.summary: Get a global property with the id specified
get.description:
Sample request (this returns a **global property** with **id = 1**):
        GET /api/globalproperties/1

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the global property you want to get

schema.description: The id of the global property you want to get

put.summary: Update all properties of the global property specified by the id
put.description:
Sample request (this updates the **global property**):
    POST /api/globalproperties/1
    {
        "id": 1,
        "name": "GP1",
		"value": "GP Value"
    }

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The global property id

schema.description: The global property id

delete.summary: Delete the global property having the specified ed
delete.description:
Sample request (This deletes a **global property** with **id = 22**):
    DELETE /api/globalproperties/22

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the global property to delete

schema.description: The id of the global property to delete

200.description: Returns a list of job histories

get.summary: Get a list of job history notes for the given job id
get.description:
Sample request (returns a list of **notes** for the job history with the specified job *id*):
    GET /api/jobhistories/2021|03|16|someJob/notes

200.description: Returns a list of job history notes

put.summary: Update a list of job history notes for the given job id
put.description:
Sample request (updates the **history job note** for the job with the specified *id*):
    PUT /api/jobhistories/2021|03|16|jobName/notes

200.description: Returns a list of job history notes

get.summary: Get a list of tags based on the criteria specified
get.description:
Sample request (this returns a list of **tags** by **name** in **descending** order starting with offset 2 and up to limit 2):
    GET ?sortby=name:asc&limit=2&offset=2

post.summary: Create a new tag and return it with its details, if successful

requestBody.description: Name of tag to be added

get.summary: Get a list of tags based on name specified
get.description:
Sample request (this returns a list of **tags** with name like **name**):
    GET /api/jobtags/?name=testtag:

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of tag

schema.description: Name of tag

delete.description:
Sample request (this deletes a specified **tag**):
        DELETE /api/jobtags/{tagname}

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of tag to be deleted

schema.description: Name of tag to be deleted

200.description: Returns a list of machine groups

post.summary: Create a new access code and return it with its id, if successful

get.summary: Get an machine group for the id specified
get.description:
Sample request (this returns the **machine group** with **id = 1**):  
        GET /api/machinegroups/1

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the machine group you want to get

schema.description: The id of the machine group you want to get

put.summary: Update all properties of the machine group specified by the id

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The machine group id

schema.description: The machine group id

inUse.description: The quantity of schedules and/or jobs using this frequency

aobn.description: The A/O/B/N value of the frequency

calendar.description: The calendar associated with the frequency

id.description: The id of the job dependency **type**

name.description: The name of the job dependency **type**

condition.description: The condition of the job dependency **type**

checkAllDays.description: The check all days value of the job dependency **type**

offset.description: The offset in days of the job dependency **type**

jobNameLike.description: The job name like value of the job dependency **type**

Calendar.description: A calendar with id, type, Schedule, Dates and name fields

id.description: The id of the job dependency predecessor schedule, if the daily schedule exists

date.description: The date of the job dependency predecessor schedule, if the daily schedule exists

name.description: The name of the job dependency predecessor schedule

id.description: The daily job id of the job dependency **predecessor**, if the daily job exists

name.description: The job name of the job dependency **predecessor**

status.description: The status of the job dependency **predecessor**, if the daily job exists

isSatisfied.description: The status of the **daily job dependency**

expression1.description: The string value for the expression.

expression2.description: The string value for the expression.

AccessCode.description: An access code with id and name fields

id.description:
Numeric id of the role.
optional

name.description:
Name of the role.Must be unique.
optional

inheritAllSchedulePrivileges.description:
When true, this role's privileges will be applied to all schedules.
optional

inheritAllMachinePrivileges.description:
When true, this role's privileges will be applied to all machines.
optional

inheritAllMachineGroupPrivileges.description:
When true, this role's privileges will be applied to all machine groups.
optional

inheritAllEmbeddedScriptPrivileges.description:
When true, this role's privileges will be applied to all embeddedscripts.
optional

loginName.description: User name for the batch user

password.description:
This field is not returned on a GET request.It may be sent in a POST request.If the filed is null in a PUT request, it gets ignored and the existing value is unchanged.
optional

roles.description:
Roles associated with this batch user
optional

bcc.description: The receiver(s) being blind carbon copied

name.description: The name of machine that will be used for notification
The name assign to the job

triggerName.description: The name of the escalation trigger

action.description: The action that will take place

groupOfId.description: The unique identifier of the group

notifyDelimiter.description: Special character used to separate notifications

escalationId.description: The unique identifier of the escalation

status.description: The status assigned to the escalation

timeMessageSent.description: Time stamp for last message sent

acknowledgeTime.description: The time the escalation was acknowledged

acknowledgeHostName.description: The host name that acknowledged the notification

acknowledged.description: Flag describing whether the notification was acknowledged

id.description: The interger value for the given type of LSAM Feeback

name.description: The name for the given type of LSAM Feedback

value.description: Text value for the global property

encrypted.description: Specifies if the global property is encrypted

fullName.description: Full Name of the global property

category.description: Category for the global property (GI, MI, SI, JI)

isPatternValue.description: Specifies whether the global property's values is a pattern

Token.description:
Enter 'Token [space] {your token}' in the text input below.  
  
Example: **Token 1234-5abc-def**
Token.name: Authorization
